Description: Rest on the Flight into Egypt; the Virgin seated with the Child in her arms leaning out, St Joseph standing at right, a donkey resting at left Pen and brown ink, with brown wash, heightened with white, on grey prepared paper
Curator's comments: Created as an independent work, this probably dates from the late 1560s. The composition is based on a Veronese drawing in Cleveland. The present drawing probably served as a model for Veronese's painting of the subject, now in Ottawa, although there are a number of differences (Pignatti, II, fig. 689). A more faithful painted version of the drawing by a follower of Veronese is in the High Museum of Art, Atlanta (Pignatti, II, fig. 721). Van Dyck made a copy of the present drawing, see 1957,1214.207.2. Another copy with an old attribution to Erasmus Quellinus but offered as Hans Rottenhammer was sold at Sotheby's, New York, 30 January 2019, lot 9. Lit.: G.
